programme.title: Whitechapel
programme.desc: When ambitious DI Joseph Chandler is assigned what looks like a simple case of domestic violence, he thinks a quick result will line him up for promotion. However, when the investigation runs out of suspects, Chandler finds an alternative theory from Edward Buchan, an expert on Jack the Ripper. Buchan points out the similarities between the murder and the Ripper's killings, and the race is on to catch the copycat killer.

programme.title: Whitechapel
programme.desc: DI Chandler continues to clash with cynical DS Miles and the team, and the situation is not helped by difficulties with their murder investigation. New suspects only lead to dead ends, and the police struggle to penetrate the conspiracies and myths that surround the legend of Jack the Ripper. A frustrated Chandler pins his hopes on trapping their latest suspect, but the operation goes horribly wrong.

programme.title: Whitechapel
programme.desc: The Ripper must kill one more victim to complete his re-enactment of the 1888 murders. DI Chandler is near to breakdown as he struggles to find an answer. Forensics and CCTV are useless, and the team are forced to rely on their instincts, hoping that the past will provide some clue to the killer's identity. However, time is ticking away, and history tells us that Jack the Ripper was never caught.

programme.title: Pound Shop Wars
programme.desc: Chris fights to win customers who traditionally, wouldn't be seen dead in a pound shop - the middle classes. He also tries to make pound shop history by becoming the first to go online.

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: The team are in Crawley to help two brothers renovate their kitchen/diner. The boys are at a loss and unable to progress. Plus, three more families hoping for a rescue next time.

programme.desc: More daring rescues for the Yorkshire Air Ambulance medics. A blazing car plunges off a bridge onto the motorway, and a cow leaves a farmer with some serious injuries.

programme.desc: The team at St Vincent's hospital treat a man who was assaulted with a hammer and had hydrochloric acid thrown into his face. Doctors attempt to stabilise his condition.

programme.title: Kings Cross ER

programme.title: Countdown to Murder
programme.desc: Schoolteacher Carol Parks's body was found in Coniston Water in 1997, 21 years after she disappeared. Her husband, Gordon, was eventually convicted of her murder, but his reasons for the crime and how he managed to evade capture remain unanswered.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A woman with lupus suffers a cardiac arrest and dies after overdosing on antihistamines. Dr G must determine if the woman died as a result of the overdose or due to her condition.

programme.title: Born to Kill?
programme.desc: In 2002, two gunmen terrorised the American capital with random fatal shootings, but was their appetite for murder innate or learned?

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Bringing the best in entertainment and teleshopping.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A woman with lupus suffers a cardiac arrest and dies after overdosing on antihistamines. Dr G must determine if the woman died as a result of the overdose or due to her condition.

programme.title: Countdown to Murder
programme.desc: Schoolteacher Carol Parks's body was found in Coniston Water in 1997, 21 years after she disappeared. Her husband, Gordon, was eventually convicted of her murder, but his reasons for the crime and how he managed to evade capture remain unanswered.

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: The team are in Navenby to help Maaike Zaan and John Heather complete the renovation to their disused telephone exchange. Maaike was diagnosed with osteonecrosis, a condition which means her bone marrow has died in both her hips and knees. This brought all renovation work to a stop. The plan is to create a multi-functional room with an eco-friendly heating system so that Maaike can have a space to work on her hobbies.

programme.title: Celebrity Fantasy Homes
programme.desc: Socialite Lady Victoria Hervey chats about life in LA as Gaby Roslin helps her to find the perfect country retreat near Windsor in Berkshire.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Bringing the best in entertainment and teleshopping.

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman goes house-hunting with a couple who are leaving East London life to move to Cambridgeshire with their two children. With a budget of £450,000, good schools and a large garden are a must. They are after contemporary country living, so will a medieval 15th-century coach house be too daunting a proposition?

programme.title: Celebrity Fantasy Homes
programme.desc: Singer and TV presenter Mica Paris tells Gaby Roslin about success, bankruptcy and the relaunch of her career as she house hunts in Sardinia.

programme.title: The Sheriffs Are Coming
programme.desc: The sheriffs help a pensioner that was left with a pile of bricks instead of the driveway she paid for.

programme.title: Helicopter Heroes
programme.desc: A nurse becomes a difficult patient for the helimed team, there is a race to save a farm worker trapped in machinery and a pensioner's car careers half a mile down a hill-side.

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: James Braxton has a long way to catch Charlie Ross as they battle it out to make profits from antiques. They start in the fishing village of Cullen in the Highlands of Scotland and end in Aberdeen for the auction showdown.

programme.desc: The team head to a medical museum in Leeds, where a spirit doctor is said to roam.

programme.desc: The ghoul-chasing gang visit the rather ominously named Tombstone in New Mexico, where the ghosts of a haunted gathering hall await.

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: It is the start of another road trip and Anita Manning and Philip Serrell are travelling through the north of England in their classic car, with the aim of turning a profit on their items at auction in Edinburgh.

programme.title: Secret Eaters
programme.desc: In Birmingham, sisters Sharon and Tracy are at a loss to explain their expanding midriff. They're puzzled at the rate they are piling on the pounds, and desperate to understand why their weight is spiralling out of control.

programme.title: Nurses Who Kill *
programme.desc: Anne Grigg-Booth was accused of murdering three patients at a hospital in Yorkshire, but died of an overdose while awaiting trial. Was her drug and alcohol addiction to blame?

programme.title: Countdown to Murder
programme.desc: Sixty-five-year-old Maureen Cosgrove was a pillar of her local community, but when unemployed drifter George Maben fell in love with her youngest daughter and moved in, Maureen had unwittingly invited her murderer into her home.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: When a 75-year-old woman dies after a minor car accident, despite no significant injuries or medical ailments, it's up to Dr G to determine the cause of death.

programme.title: Born to Kill?
programme.desc: The concluding episode in this investigative series profiles Ivan Milat, the murderer of numerous backpackers in Australia in the 1990s. What led him to kill?

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: The team are in Grays, Essex to help busy paramedic Tina Freear renovate her lounge/dining room. Tina bought her house five years ago with the best intentions but work has ground to a halt. Alongside her busy job as a paramedic she has struggled to cope with a collection of cowboy builders. Plus, three more families appeal for rescue in the next programme.
